title: Ben Foden makes dig at ex Una Healy ahead of Celebrity X Factor debut
text:

Ben Foden has revealed his singing used to seriously get under the skin of his former wife Una Healy .

Ahead of his Celebrity X-Factor debut, the ex-England rugby ace has opened up about how the Saturdays' star used to try and help get his vocal chords going.

The 34-year-old says she quickly ran out of patience with him - and that he is now enjoying working with pro coaches.

The pair's six-year marriage crumbled after he admitted cheating last year.

He says he made the "biggest, most stupid mistake" by being unfaithful to the singer, with whom he shares Aoife, seven, Tadhg, four.

(Image: WireImage)

(Image: Getty Images Europe)

Ben is trying to move forward and hopes the Celebrity X-Factor can give him a new focus.

He said: "Una was always really supportive of me doing singing and stuff. I did shows. I did singing on All Together Now and League Of Their Own, and Una was always very supportive of me doing that.

"She’d always coach me a little bit. But she doesn’t have very much patience with me because I’m not the best singer. And, she’d be like: “do this” and I’m like “I don’t know what that is,” and she’d be like: “everyone knows what that is in the singing industry!”

"So, it’s been great for us to go and actually work with real vocal coaches and learn how to harmonize and learn all the serious sides about being in a band together.

(Image: PA)

"So I did get the tiniest fraction of a little bit of head start. But we all have individual starts: Levi comes from a musical school, Tom was in a boyband back in 1964."

He wants Una to forgive him for how their marriage ended.

The sportsman told The Sun: "I hope Una will forgive me. I made the biggest mistake and the most ­stupid mistake you can make in a relationship."

(Image: ben_foden/Instagram)

He added: "We seemed like a perfect match but people never know what happens behind closed doors. I think it’s safe to say that Una and I were struggling for a number of years.

"Me doing what I did was the final nail in the coffin."

Meanwhile, Una has moved on with Irish sportsman David Breen. She found love after bumping into her man in a coffee shop.
description: After a tweet from him was unearthed saying the show was on it's last legs, the former rugby star has spoken out again
